page.title: 08Playing Rugby In Wales.
page.content: Rugby is played in many countries & towns.It is our favourite sport.There are tries,conversions & penalties. There is a full back,two centres,two wings an out side half & a scrum half in the backs.The forwards are two props,two locks,two flankers,a hooker & a number eight.The rules are:- One of the teams kicks off.If the ball should go forward from a hand it's a scrum to the other side.The scrum half puts the ball in & both sides push.To score a try you must run to the try line & put the ball on the floor. If a man should foul another man there is a penalty.They can kick or run with the ball.If the ball goes off the pitch there is a line out.The hooker has to throw the ball in to play on. Our school has 2 Rugby teams & Mumbles is the nearest club.By Mark Booth, Matthew Bowyer and Stephen Morgan.
